instruction: List the continents in order of size, beginning with the largest.
output: The continents ordered by size from largest to smallest are Asia, Africa, North America, South America, Antarctica, Europe, and Australia.

instruction:
Reorganize the words to form a complete sentence.

university/enroll/parents/urged/their/to/children
output: Parents were urged to enroll their children in university.

instruction: Write a short story about a person who can transform into an animal.
output: Once upon a time, there was a person named Asha who had the unique power to transform into any animal she wished. Every morning, she turned into a wolf and ran around the city before turning back into a human. Asha was fascinated by the different abilities each animal had and enjoyed discovering new things. One day, she stumbled upon a mysterious dark cave and decided to explore it as a wolf. As she ventured further into the cave, she began to feel the power of transformation leave her. When she emerged, she was no longer a wolf, but an eagle. She soared over her city, seeing the world in a new and amazing way. From that day on, she embraced her newfound power and used it to explore the world.

instruction:
Paraphrase the following sentence.

She was totally surprised when she heard the news.
output: When she got the news, she was shocked beyond belief.

instruction:
Edit the following sentence to make it concise.

I went to the store for the purpose of buying flour.
output: I went to the store to buy flour.

instruction: Construct a poem with five lines that describes the sunset.
output:
The sun sets in a blaze of orange and red,
A sky alight with beauty overhead.
The shadows cast by trees of deepest green,
A perfect end to a perfect day seen.
The beauty of the setting sun never ceases,
No better sight can make my heart so at peace.

instruction: What is the altitude of the Mt Tauern mountain in Austria?
output: The altitude of Mt Tauern in Austria is 2,825 meters (9,273 feet).

instruction: Design a website for an international travel agency.
output: I will design a website for the international travel agency that includes interactive features to help customers find their ideal vacation easily. It will feature a search bar for searching for various destinations and attractions, as well as offering detailed information about the different locations. There will also be a booking page, where customers can reserve their tickets and accommodations, as well as provide payment information. The website will be organized and user-friendly, with a modern design and easily navigable features.

instruction: Research the recipe for 'battered apple pie' and create the necessary steps to make the dish.
output: To make battered apple pie, begin by preheating your oven to 350Â°F. Peel, core, and slice two large apples, then set aside. In a medium bowl, mix together 1 cup of all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon of baking powder, and 1/4 cup of butter, cut into small pieces. Slowly add 2/3 cup of milk and stir until a thick batter forms. Grease a 9-inch pie dish, then spread the batter in the dish. Place the apples in the batter and sprinkle with 2 tablespoons of sugar and 1/4 teaspoon of cinnamon. Bake for 40 minutes, then cool before serving.

instruction: How many players are on the field during a regular football match?
output: During a regular football match, there are typically 11 players on the field from each team.

instruction: Order the following list of ingredients from lowest to highest in calories
output: Black beans, almonds, cheddar cheese (lowest to highest in calories).

instruction: Generate a rap that uses the following words
output:
I'm blessed with wisdom, knowledge I can attain
Focus on the prize and don't succumb to the pain
Everything that I face I'll swiftly overcome
The future is bright, can't let it stay undone
No more stress, no more pain, no more strife
My wisdom will be a beacon of my life

instruction: Edit the following text so that it is grammatically correct and employs sophisticated language.
input: The moon is a pretty sight to see.
output: The visage of the moon is captivating, lending an air of serene beauty.

instruction: Create a 3-4 sentence story using the following words: ship, storm, rope.
output: A cold and fierce storm was brewing on the open sea. A valiant captain stood fearlessly on the deck of his ship, holding tightly to the rope, his only chance for survival. The waves roared and the wind howled, threatening to rip the ship apart. Yet, the captain never lost his grip on the lifeline, determined that he and his crew will make it out safely.

instruction: Write a definition (10 words or fewer) for the word "epiphany".
output: Epiphany: A sudden, profound realization or insight.

instruction: Write a simple math equation to calculate 10% of 200.
Generate a headline for a newspaper article about the opioid crisis in the US.
output: "The Plight of the United States: An In-Depth Look at the Opioid Crisis"

instruction: List three key points about the US economy.
output:
1. The US has the largest economy in the world in terms of gross domestic product.
2. The US economy is highly globalized and technological advances have been driving productivity. 
3. Inequality is rising in the US, with the top 1 % of households owning more than half of the country's wealth.

instruction: Name two of the Great Lakes.
Summarize the presidential powers granted by the Constitution of the United States.
output: The Constitution grants the President of the United States the power to sign treaties, appoint cabinet members, veto bills, grant reprieves and pardons, deliver messages to Congress, call for the Militia to suppress Insurrections, and head the Executive Branch.
